description: System-generated unique key for this asset status record, used as the primary identifier in the database.
Business identifier or code for the asset status, used in selection lists, validations, and automation rules.
Free-text explanation of what the status means and when it should be applied.
Flag indicating this is the default status assigned when creating a new asset.
Flag to exclude this status from selection lists and other lookup controls in the application.
Flag to exclude this status, and assets in it, from analytics, dashboards, and printed reports.
Controls whether preventive maintenance schedules and work orders are generated while assets are in this status.
Indicates the status option is retired and should not be selectable for future use.
Additional notes or internal comments about the status for user reference.
Timestamp when this record was last changed by any process (user or system).
Likely timestamp of the most recent user-initiated change; may duplicate other audit fields; confirm with SME.
Flag to suppress assets in this status from hierarchical tree views or navigation.
Login or identifier of the user who created this record.
Timestamp when this record was first created.
Login or identifier of the user who last updated this record.
Timestamp when this record was last updated by a user.
